brand_info: Unilever is a British-Dutch multinational company offering consumer goods including foods, beverages, cleaning agents, and personal care products.

recent_esg_news.title: Unilever commits to net zero emissions by 2039
recent_esg_news.summary: Unilever announced its goal to achieve net zero emissions across its supply chain by 2039. The company also plans to invest €1 billion in a climate and nature fund to support initiatives that reduce emissions and improve biodiversity.

brand_info: Nestlé is a Swiss multinational food and drink processing conglomerate, recognized as the largest food company in the world.

recent_esg_news.title: Nestlé to cut plastic waste with investment in sustainable packaging
recent_esg_news.summary: Nestlé pledged to invest up to CHF 2 billion to shift from virgin plastics to food-grade recycled plastics and accelerate development of sustainable packaging solutions to reduce plastic waste.

brand_info: PepsiCo is an American multinational food, snack, and beverage corporation.

recent_esg_news.title: PepsiCo sets 2040 net-zero emissions goal and expands regenerative farming
recent_esg_news.summary: PepsiCo committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2040, focusing on regenerative agricultural practices across 7 million acres, equivalent to the company's entire agricultural footprint.

brand_info: Procter & Gamble is an American multinational consumer goods corporation.

recent_esg_news.title: P&G aims for carbon neutrality by 2030
recent_esg_news.summary: P&G aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 50% and purchase 100% renewable electricity globally for its operations by 2030, as part of a broader strategy to become carbon neutral.

brand_info: The J. M. Smucker Company manufactures and markets branded food and beverage products.

recent_esg_news.title: Smucker's highlights sustainable sourcing in responsibility report
recent_esg_news.summary: Smucker’s sustainability report outlined efforts in responsibly sourcing coffee, reducing water usage, and enhancing packaging recyclability as part of its commitment to ethical and environmental standards.

brand_info: Walgreens Boots Alliance is a global pharmacy-led health and wellbeing enterprise.

recent_esg_news.title: Walgreens launches green building initiative
recent_esg_news.summary: Walgreens began retrofitting over 1,000 stores with energy-efficient systems, aiming to cut greenhouse gas emissions and reduce energy consumption as part of its broader sustainability goals.

brand_info: Hormel Foods Corporation produces and markets various meat and food products.

recent_esg_news.title: Hormel recognized for supply chain sustainability by CDP
recent_esg_news.summary: Hormel was named to the CDP Supplier Engagement Leaderboard for its efforts in managing environmental impacts within its supply chain and improving water conservation across facilities.

brand_info: The Estée Lauder Companies is a manufacturer and marketer of skincare, makeup, and fragrance products.

recent_esg_news.title: Estée Lauder achieves 100% renewable electricity
recent_esg_news.summary: Estée Lauder announced it now uses 100% renewable electricity for its direct operations globally and is advancing efforts toward net-zero carbon emissions by investing in energy efficiency and green technologies.

brand_info: Sysco Corporation is a multinational distributor of food and related products to restaurants and institutions.

recent_esg_news.title: Sysco to power all operations with renewable electricity by 2030
recent_esg_news.summary: Sysco committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity for its global operations and has also introduced low-emission fleet vehicles as part of its climate action plan.

brand_info: Kellogg's is an American multinational food manufacturing company.

recent_esg_news.title: Kellogg’s sets sustainability targets for emissions and packaging
recent_esg_news.summary: Kellogg’s set new environmental goals, including cutting greenhouse gas emissions by 65% and shifting to 100% reusable, recyclable, or compostable packaging by 2025.
